page.title: 05HOUSING IN HAM
page.content: The most modern houses in Ham were built in 1982 on part of Ham Lands overlooking the River Thames. They are detached with 3 or 4 bedrooms. There is an estate of houses built by WATES the builders in 1965. They are 3 and 2 storey buildings of wood panels and brick, in 4 styles. There is a 1950s development of mock Tudor houses built on the border between Ham and Kingston which are semi-detached with 3 bedrooms. There are council built houses of red brick with 3 or 4 bedrooms and 6 storey council flats. The oldest houses in Ham are the Goergian houses on Ham Common and the Petersham Road, the Victorian cottages in Lock Road and the two timber framed Elizabethan buildings near the Petersham Road. Prices are from Â£50,000 to Â£500,000.
